result.execSummary:
The defendant Harvey A Talley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Deg.Sexual Assault/Great Bodily Harm, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(1)(a).
  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two; concurrent with cases 15CM1221 and 15CM1276.  Credit for 117 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Cooperate and participate with a psychological evaluation.  Follow any recommended treatment.

No contact with victim Alexis D.
No contact with the victim's mother/defendant's wife Tryphena G. unless contact is consented by Tryphena G. and approved by Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
Court ordered that any visitation  defendant has with the victim's child is to occur only through a third party contact and the third party must be approved by Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
Pay child support for the victim's child as ordered by Family Court.  Any cash bail on deposit is to be applied to child support.

Comply with the standard rules of Extended Supervision.
Coperate and participate with sex offender evaluation and domestic abuse assessments,  and follow any recommended treatment.
Cooperate and particiapte with any other programming deemed appropriate by Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
Successfully complete a parenting class and a Cognitive Behavior therapy.
Defendant to comply with the permanent sex offender reporting requirement.
Restitution set at zero.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment.  Follow any recoommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay DNA surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one, concurrent to cases 15CM1221 and 15CM1276.  Credit for 117 days.

charges.descr: Sex with Child Age 16 or Older

records.addlTxt: Count one.
Count two.

Defendant Harvey A Talley in court with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson.  Defendant Harvey A Talley in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements made by defendant's wife, Tryphena G. AND defendant's mother, Barbara A.

AS TO COUNT 1:    The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 16 YEARS, concurrent to Count #2.  Concurrent to case #s 15CM1221 and 15CM1276.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 8 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 8 YEARS.
Credit given for 117 days time served.

AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the House of Correction (will be served in Wisconsin State Prisons) for 9 MONTHS, concurrent to Count #1.  Concurrent to case#s 15CM1221 and 15CM1276.
Credit given for 117 days time served.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2):
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with the victim, Alexis D.
* No contact with the victim's mother/defendant's wife, Tryphena G., UNLESS CONTACT IS CONSENTED BY TRYPHENA G. AND APPROVED BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.
* Cooperate and participate with a psychological evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with sex offender evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with a domestic abuse assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with any other programming deemed appropriate by Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Successfully complete a parenting class.
* Successfully complete a vocational class.
* Successfully complete cognitive behavior therapy.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.  CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO APPLY.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.  CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO APPLY.
* PAY child support for the victim's child as ordered by Family Court.  ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT IS TO BE APPLIED TO CHILD SUPPORT.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered defendant to comply with the PERMANENT sex offender reporting requirement.
* Court ordered that any visitation defendant has with the victim's child is to occur only through a 3rd party contact AND the 3rd party must be approved by Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
* Court ordered restitution set at ZERO. 
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Justice Point Discharge Summary Report, Filed
Stipulation and Order for Return/Destruction of Exhibits; filed.  (Exhibit #s 1 - 7).

Defendant Harvey A Talley in court with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Jury in box at 10:30 AM.
Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 12:30 PM to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputy, Spotek who was duly sworn for that purpose.  At the hour of 3:30 PM the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict as follows:  

Count 1:  GUILTY
Count 2:  GUILTY

which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.

*Court ordered a PSI.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Case adjourned to 11-02-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant Harvey A Talley in court with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Jury in box at 10:20 AM.
Sworn and testified for cross-examination:  Tryphena G.
Sworn and testified as a witness for the State:  MPD Sensitive Crimes Officer, Officer Gary Brown; MPD Officer, Gary Post; Wauwatosa PD Officer, and Officer Travis Machalk.

Court breaks for lunch.
Jury out of box at 11:16 AM.

Court addressed defense's reserved objections with the parties on the record.
Defense moves for a mistrial.
Arguments heard.
Court DENIED defense's two motions for a mistrial.

Jury in box at 2:30 PM.
Sworn and testified as a witness for the State: MPD Detective, Det. Tim Behning, Deputy Dennis O'Donnell, Dennis O., and Thomas B.
Court takes a break.
Jury out of box at 4:04 PM.

Jury in box at 4:23 PM.
Sworn and testified as a witness for the State:  MPD Sensitive Crimes Officer, Officer Louise Bray.
State rests subject to rebuttal.
Jury out of box at 4:33 PM.

Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  
Court examined defendant as to right to testify AND his right not to testify.
Court finds defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently waived his right to testify.

Jury in box at 4:39 PM.
Defense rests.
Court concluded for the day.
Court advised the jury to return tomorrow at 9:30 AM.
Jury out of box at 4:40 PM.

Case adjourned to 09-18-2015 at 9:30 AM for Continuation of Jury Trial.
